summary: hCoV-NL63, hCoV-HKU-1, hCoV-OC43, hCoV-229E cause respiratory tract illness in humans. at least seven different animal CoVs cause economically significant epizootics in livestock, and deadly disease in companion animals. a tremendous diversity of CoVs exists in complex mammalian and avian reservoirs. NFAT activation regulates pivotal immune processes like apoptosis, anergy, and eosinophils. an essential activation step for NFAT is its dephosphorylation by the phospatase calcineurin A (CnA), resulting in the translocation of NFAT into the nucleus. cDNA library of very high complexity (1.4107) derived from human brain. BLAST searches on 2287 DNA sequences yielded 942 different human gene hits. 132, 383, 245, and 282 hits in categories A – D respectively. 42 interactions observed only once in a screen were tested (category B) these are compared to a negative reference set of non-interacting proteins. 5,000 Medline abstracts mentioning “SARS” or “Coronavirus” were screened using the text mining program syngrep. SARS-CoV proteins target both highly interactive proteins (hubs) as well as so-called bottleneck proteins which are central to many of the shortest paths in their networks. interactions between Nsp1 and several members of the class of immunophilins were selected for experimental confirmation. the immunophilin proteins (cyclophilins and FK506-binding proteins) are all known to bind to CnA in combination with inhibitory molecules. they influence the CnA/NFAT pathway that plays a major role in the establishment of T-cell immune response [14] the increase in NFAT activity could be blocked by CspA, an inhibitor of the NFAT pathway. coexpression of other CoV proteins or coexpression of PPIA, PPIH, FKBP1A did not impact NFAT activity. hek293 cells were transiently cotransfected with NFAT reporter plasmid (NFAT luc) and expression plasmids encoding NFAT3, Calcineurin (CnA) and SARS-CoV Nsp1fl (A) calcipressin RCAN3 extenuates the effect. HEK 293lp cells were transiently transfected with NFAT reporter plasmid. the medium was supplemented with the calcineurin stimulators PMA and ionomycin (PMA/Io.) 17 h post infection the luciferase readout was carried out. expression of RCAN-3 reduced IL-8 promoter activity levels to about half. the Nsp1 protein did not induce the IL-2 promoter. HEK 293 cells were transiently cotransfected with interleukin reporter plasmids IL2 luc (A), IL4 luc (B), IL8 luc (C) and expression plasmids encoding NFAT3 and CnA. HEK 293 and Jurkat cells were transiently co-transfected with Nsp1fl and p55A2luc containing repeated PRDII elements or pAP-1-luc containing the AP-1 binding site of the IL-2 promoter. the AP-1 promotor was only slightly upregulated in HEK293 and downregulated in Jurkat cells. NFAT activation was suspected due to the high specificity of Nsp1-dependent activation of NFAT and due to the redundancy of SARS-CoV interactions with upstream elements of the CnA/NFAT pathway. it was therefore investigated whether CspA might influence viral replication. cspA concentrations used for each virus are given on the x-axis. the 50% effective dose (EC50) was calculated by regression analysis of the respective virus CPE. replicon activity in parallel reactions was controlled to be at the same level after 16 h of incubation. accumulated luciferase activities in supernatants were decreased in a CspA dose-dependent manner after 24 h. two different specific inhibitors of the CoV main protease, Cinanserin [23] and XP17 (R. H., own unpublished observations), inhibited replicon activity to a comparable extent as Csp HEK293 cells were transiently cotransfected with NFAT or IL-2 reporter plasmid (NFAT luc, IL-2 luc) and expression plasmids encoding NFAT3, Calcineurin (CnA) and SARS-CoV ORF N. l after transfection cells were cultured in absence or presence of the calcineurin stimulators PMA and ionomycin (PMA/Io) SARS-CoV ORFs were cloned in-frame with N-terminal protein A domains and co-expressed in the same cells. about 48% of category A candidates and 36% of category B candidates were confirmed positive with a Z-score >1 (Figure 1, see Materials and Methods for definition) the fractions of overlap were compared to the fraction of literature hits in the list of search terms. Abstracts were enriched for proteins identified as SARS-CoV interaction partners both in the high confidence and the complete data sets. individual ORFs were PCR amplified by primers specific for predicted N- and C- terminal ends. hydrophobic sequences were deleted from ORFs containing transmembrane regions. hypothetical ORF14 [57] was also subcloned. all tested proteins interacted with Nsp1(aa 1–93) suggesting redundant interactions of SARS-CoV with the CnA/NFAT pathway. NFAT and CnA cDNAs were overexpressed in HEK 293 cells. three versions of Nsp1 (Nsp1fl = aa 1–180, Nsp1N-terminus = aa 1–93 and Nsp1 C-terminus = aa119–180) and human cDNAs were cloned into protein A and Renilla Luciferase fusion vectors. complexes were purified via IgG-coated magnetic beads. NFAT1 and NFAT2 species were expressed instead of NFAT3 respectively. transfection cells were cultured in absence or presence of calcineurin stimulators PMA and ionomycin (PMA/Io.) and the NFAT-pathway inhibitor Cyclosporin A (CspA). HEK293 cells were co-transfected with interleukin reporter plasmids IL-2, IL-4 and IL-8. expression of Nsp1 induced the IL-2 promoter significantly by a factor of 2.5. this effect was inhibited by CspA and RCAN-3, suggesting dependence on the CnA/NFAT pathway. 2 luc (A), IL4 luc (B), IL8 luc (C) and expression plasmids encoding NFAT3, CnA and either SARS-CoV Nsp1fl or the empty plasmid vector. all experiments were also done with an additional overexpression of the Calcipressin RCAN3. HEK293 and Jurkat cells were transiently co-transfected with NFB-luc (A,C) or AP-1luc (B,D) and SARS-CoV Nsp1fl or an empty vector. induction of the cells was carried out with PMA/Io. topathic effects conferred by the compound were 3.3 M. the 50% effective dose (EC50) was calculated by regression analysis of the respective virus CPE. all tested CoVs were inhibited by CspA; replication of TGEV and IBV in the tested range (up to 25 M) was diminished close to background by CspA. a novel SARS-CoV replicon carrying a secreted Metridia luciferase reporter construct was used. replicon RNA was expressed from a eukaryotic expression vector in the same cells. an NFAT induction assay was conducted as described above. no N-dependent effect on the assay was seen. 2H is one of the most direct approaches to identify interactions between viral ORFeomes and large host cDNA libraries. it facilitates investigation of proteins expressed at low levels and of those causing weak and transient interactions. drawbacks include the inability to control and confirm expression of genes of interest. nsp1 is a virulence factor in-vivo whose action has been linked with early stages of the immune response. the increase of NFAT activation extended to all three major NFAT species, suggesting a potential for induction of broad and systemic cytokine dysregulation by affecting several types of immune cells. cytokine burst seen in other acute viral diseases in its delayed occurrence. late aggravation was correlated with severe clinical outcome. our results suggest an influence on fundamental triggers of immune cell activation. peptide inhibitors such as CspA and Tacrolimus are available that bind to immunophilins. ural NS5A and NS2 proteins interact with cyclophilins. replication can be inhibited by CspA and non-immunosuppressive derivatives thereof. it does not clarify the biological functions of the interaction between Nsp1 and its cellular partners. the large diversity of CoVs in animal reservoirs generates interest in studying how conserved this particular virus-host interaction might be between non-human CoVs and human cells. the large diversity of CoVs in animal reservoirs generates interest in studying how conserved this particular virus-host interaction might be between non-human CoVs and human cells. mate yeast strains, exponentially growing cultures at an OD600nm of 1 were combined, pelleted by centrifugation, and resuspended in an equal volume of YPDA (Yeast Extract Peptone Dextrose Adenine) yPDA (Yeast Extract Peptone Dextrose Adenine) containing 20% PEG 6000. lysate was removed to determine the luciferase activity present in each sample. negative controls were transfected with the plasmid expressing the luciferase fusion protein. negative controls were transfected with the plasmid expressing the luciferase fusion protein. reporter gene assays in viral context HEK293lp cells were transfected with 500 ng reporter plasmid using Lipofectamine LTX (Invitrogen) the results were normalized to a simultaneously transfected Renilla luciferase (pRL-null, Promega) cells were stimulated by PMA (40 ng/ml) and Ionomycin (2 M) HCoV-NL63 cells were seeded in 24-well plates. for quantitative real time RT-PCR cells were infected with a MOI = 0.004. after 1 h adsorption the viral inoculum was removed, cells were washed twice with PBS and 1 ml fresh medium supplemented with different inhibitor concentrations. ylcellulose was added after 1 h incubation at 37°C. different concentrations of CspA at a range from 0 to 25 M were mixed with the methylcellulose. the cells were fixed with 3% paraformaldehyde. cubated with 0.4% Noble Agar (Difco) overlay medium for 72 h. plaques stained with 1% crystal violet in 3.6% formaldehyde, 1% methanol, and 20% ethanol. cultures were seeded at a density of 30,000 cells per 96-well. PCR mutagenesis and classical cloning techniques ORFs 2–8 were deleted or replaced by marker genes. a secreted Metridia Luciferase (Promega) was inserted, using the original transcription-regulating sequence. for potential selection, a GFP-Zeocin fusion protein was placed in open reading frame 3a. a data set of 1184 complexes containing 2079 distinct proteins was obtained. we analyzed 9 complexes which targeted at least four subunits by SARS proteins. p-values were corrected for multiple testing using the FDR- method. C8166 SEAP cells were cultured in RPMI-medium with 10% FBS and 1% penicillin/streptomycin. y2H library screening Cloning of the SARS ORFeome into destination bait vector pGBKT7-DEST for Y2H screening was described previously [6], [47], with the following modifications. lipofectamine 2,000 transfected into 10,000 HEK293 cells. cells were lysed on ice in 10 l of ice-cold lysis buffer. negative controls were transfected with plasmid expressing luciferase fusion protein. the mean and standard deviation were calculated from large datasets of protein pairs which were not expected to interact. normalised signal to noise ratios were calculated as follows: (bound/input)/(bound nc/input nc)[10]. at a confluence of 80%, cells were washed with phosphate buffered saline (PBS) and infected with a MOI = 0.0001. supernatants were tested after 24 h p.i. and 48 h p.i. plaques stained with 0.2% crystal violet, 11% formaldehyde, 2% ethanol, and 2% paraformaldehyde. HCoV-229E Huh-7 cells were seeded in 24-well plates and incubated until the monolayer was 70–80% confluent. 106 FCWF cells were seeded in 12-well plates. cells were infected for 1 h, washed with 1 ml PBS and incubated with 0.4% Noble Agar (Difco) overlay medium. HIV-1 replication was monitored microscopically via cytopathic effects. in all experiments the outcome of the mock-treated cells were set as 100%. DMSO was always added as a control corresponding to the highest inhibitor concentration. viral RNA was extracted from cell culture supernatant with the QIAamp Viral RNA mini kit. real time RT-PCR and determination of viral replication by plaque assay was done. HCoV-229E Huh-7 cells were seeded in 24-well plates. cells were washed twice with PBS and infected with a MOI = 0.000066. 106 FCWF cells were seeded in 12-well plates. cells were infected with respective virus dilutions. HIV-1 replication was monitored microscopically via cytopathic effects. half of the culture medium was discarded on day 3 and replaced by fresh medium inhibitor. replicon RNA and N RNA were transcribed and electroporated in BHK cells as described [51] for inhibitor assays, cells were seeded in 6 well plates after electroporation using 2104 cells per well and incubated for 16 hours at 37°C. hereafter, supernatant was removed entirely and cells were washed twice with PBS. gene ontology (GO) over-representation analysis. p-values were corrected for multiple testing using the FDR-method. protein complexes for humans were extracted from the CORUM database[53] high degree and betweenness centrality are alternative measures of network centrality for individual proteins. high degree characterizes so-called hubs which are highly interactive. high betweenness centrality characterizes so-called bottlenecks which are central to many connections between proteins. values are given in log scale at the indicated cyclosporine A concentrations. starting titers of different viruses were all different, i.e. in the case of a low starting titer the drop is not as prominent as in infections with high starting titers. down assays were manually screened for interactions between a human and a SARS protein. in this way, 28 known interactions between SARS proteins and their human interaction partners were identified.
